intro: Helianthemum cinereum var. argenteum, commonly known as silver sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features succulent, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a subtle floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its drought tolerance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
